content.text:
[@ev](@8Qee0I/DwI5DHSCi3p5fsl6FyLGArrnDz3ox9qZr5Qc=.ed25519) 

After a quick re-read, it strikes me that I've missed out on something important: with the exception of beef, I really enjoy reading both your opinions and code around the web. I've never seen a technical opinion of yours that wasn't valuable, and I want to stress that every personal interaction I've ever had with you has been overwhelmingly positive, both here and on Decent.

Somehow that was lost in my write-edit-copy-edit-shitwheredidthatlinkgo-copy-paste-edit cycle, so I want to apologize for spending a less-than-necessary amount of time clarifying that fact. Scaling communities means that there will eventually be beef, but I'm hoping we can deal with conflicts in a healthy way that doesn't deteriorate our edges or compromise the Very Good Things about this space.
